title: 1.92 Second Averaged Interplanetary Magnetic Field - Adam Szabo (NASA GSFC)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch2' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/voyager/voyager2/magnetic_fields_cdaweb/mag_2s/1977/voyager2_2s_mag_19770824_v01.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 99.7297% of the 129149 timesteps. Cadence = 1920 [ms] = PT1.92S.

parameters.name: F1_100nt
parameters.description: [100nT Plot Scale] B-Magnitude by Method 1 (F1): 1.92 second averge of detail magnitudes. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['F1']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: F2_100nt
parameters.description: ---> B-Magnitude by Method 2 (F2): average derived from 1.92 second component averages=sqrt(B1**2+B2**2+B3**2). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['F2']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
